title: 1770-A
statement: A. Koxia and Whiteboardstime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputKiyora has $$$n$$$ whiteboards numbered from $$$1$$$ to $$$n$$$. Initially, the $$$i$$$-th whiteboard has the integer $$$a_i$$$ written on it.Koxia performs $$$m$$$ operations. The $$$j$$$-th operation is to choose one of the whiteboards and change the integer written on it to $$$b_j$$$.Find the maximum possible sum of integers written on the whiteboards after performing all $$$m$$$ operations.InputEach test consists of multiple test cases. The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\leq t \\leq 1000$$$) — the number of test cases. The description of test cases follows.The first line of each test case contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$m$$$ ($$$1 \\le n,m \\le 100$$$).The second line of each test case contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \\ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \\le a_i \\le 10^9$$$).The third line of each test case contains $$$m$$$ integers $$$b_1, b_2, \\ldots, b_m$$$ ($$$1 \\le b_i \\le 10^9$$$).OutputFor each test case, output a single integer — the maximum possible sum of integers written on whiteboards after performing all $$$m$$$ operations.ExampleInput43 21 2 34 52 31 23 4 51 110015 31 1 1 1 11000000000 1000000000 1000000000Output12 9 1 3000000002NoteIn the first test case, Koxia can perform the operations as follows:Choose the $$$1$$$-st whiteboard and rewrite the integer written on it to $$$b_1=4$$$.Choose the $$$2$$$-nd whiteboard and rewrite to $$$b_2=5$$$.After performing all operations, the numbers on the three whiteboards are $$$4$$$, $$$5$$$ and $$$3$$$ respectively, and their sum is $$$12$$$. It can be proven that this is the maximum possible sum achievable.In the second test case, Koxia can perform the operations as follows:Choose the $$$2$$$-nd whiteboard and rewrite to $$$b_1=3$$$.Choose the $$$1$$$-st whiteboard and rewrite to $$$b_2=4$$$.Choose the $$$2$$$-nd whiteboard and rewrite to $$$b_3=5$$$.The sum is $$$4 + 5 = 9$$$. It can be proven that this is the maximum possible sum achievable.

You are given $n$ whiteboards, each with an integer written on it.  There are $m$ operations you can perform. Each operation lets you choose a whiteboard and change the integer on it to a new value.

Find the largest possible sum of the integers on all the whiteboards after performing all $m$ operations. 

**Input:**

* $t$: the number of test cases
* For each test case:
    * $n$: the number of whiteboards
    * $m$: the number of operations
    * $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$: the initial integers on the whiteboards
    * $b_1, b_2, ..., b_m$: the new integers to write on the whiteboards during the operations

**Output:**

* For each test case, output the largest possible sum of the integers on the whiteboards after all operations.
You are given a list of numbers. You can change some of the numbers to new values. What is the largest possible sum of all the numbers after the changes?
